metadata.title: CVE-2016-4332 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The library's failure to check if certain message types support aparticular flag, the HDF5 1.8.16 library will cast the structure to analternative structure and then assign to fields that aren't supported bythe message type and the library will write outside the bounds of the heapbuffer. This can lead to code execution under the context of the library.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4332` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
hdf5-tools - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-cpp-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-java - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-mpich-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
libhdf5-openmpi-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.0-patch1+docs-1~exp5').
